title: A ventilation scheme design for the electrical control space in a residential community
requirement: A ventilation scheme design for the electrical control space in a residential community In the electrical control spaces of residential communities, under conditions of high temperature and high humidity, toxic gases, and emergencies, design a comprehensive and effective ventilation plan that simultaneously meets the functions of daily ventilation, smoke extraction, and emergency ventilation, ensuring the normal operation of equipment and the safety of staff.
solution: This paper proposes a ventilation solution for addressing high temperature and high humidity, toxic gases, and emergencies in the electrical control spaces of residential communities. Finally, to respond to emergencies such as smoke and leaks, mixed ventilation technology is used by combining natural and artificial methods to improve ventilation efficiency, quickly eliminating smoke and leaks, and ensuring safety. title: A novel design scheme for a permanent magnet energy-saving and bidirectional buffering elevator
requirement: A novel design scheme for a permanent magnet energy-saving and bidirectional buffering elevator During the elevator operation process, address the issue of torque imbalance between the counterweight side and the car side to achieve energy savings; at the same time, ensure the operational safety of the elevator in emergency situations by effectively cushioning to reduce impact force and recover energy through power generation.
solution: This paper proposes a new energy-saving and bi-directional buffering elevator design scheme based on a permanent magnet eddy current torque regulator. Specifically, first, considering the issue of increased energy consumption caused by torque imbalance between the counterweight side and the car side during elevator operation, a permanent magnet eddy current torque regulator (technology0) and a dynamic torque sensor (technology1) are used. By monitoring and adjusting the eddy current coupling area, real-time torque balance is achieved, reducing power consumption. Secondly, to address the problem of potential equipment and safety damage caused by emergency conditions (such as bottoming out or overrunning), a bi-directional buffering device (technology3) combined with an energy storage device (technology2) is adopted. During an impact, inertia force is absorbed by maximizing the coupling area and converted into stored electrical energy, achieving both impact buffering and energy recovery. Ultimately, the new scheme significantly improves the energy efficiency and safety of elevator operation while enhancing the system's automation and intelligence levels.

title: Analysis of the prefabricated design scheme for a data center project in Shanghai.
requirement: Analysis of the prefabricated design scheme for a data center project in Shanghai. The project requires the reasonable selection of prefabricated components (such as beams, columns, and floor slabs) to ensure an efficient balance between construction cost, efficiency, and policy requirements, while optimizing design and construction processes as much as possible.
solution: This paper proposes a prefabricated design and construction plan to address issues related to high load, assembly rate requirements, and process complexity. So far, the project's foundation engineering has been completed, and the subsequent production and installation of prefabricated components are steadily advancing.

title: Design of the Anti-Bursting Scheme for the Deep Pressurized Water Foundation Pit in Linjiang and Analysis of the Impact of Foundation Pit Excavation on the Surrounding Environment
requirement: Design of the Anti-Bursting Scheme for the Deep Pressurized Water Foundation Pit in Linjiang and Analysis of the Impact of Foundation Pit Excavation on the Surrounding Environment Under the conditions of complex geological formations, a water-rich pressurized environment, and the presence of sensitive surrounding structures, complete the excavation task of the foundation pit for the working shaft on the southern bank of the Yangtze River Tunnel with a pit depth of 34.65m, ensuring the stability of the foundation pit, controlling gushes, and meeting the standards for surface settlement and deformation of surrounding structures.
solution: This paper proposes an anti-bursting scheme design for the ultra-deep foundation pit with high-pressure water in Linjiang. title: Design and economic analysis of the temporary support system scheme for post-cast belt PVC concrete columns in the stadium

title: Application scenarios and scheme design of household multifunctional combination valves
requirement: Application scenarios and scheme design of household multifunctional combination valves Under the conditions of meeting the requirements for anti-water theft management, ensuring accurate water meter measurement, stabilizing water pressure, and improving water quality, design a multi-functional combination valve solution for household pipelines.
solution: This paper proposes a design scheme for a multifunctional household combination valve. Through the design and production of energy-saving wall materials and thermal insulation green building materials, coupled with optimization of key process sequences, production costs are reduced, achieving the goal of energy-saving and environmental protection throughout the lifecycle of industrial building products.

title: Design of a refined cost management plan for construction engineering projects based on BIM technology
requirement: Design of a refined cost management plan for construction engineering projects based on BIM technology In the entire lifecycle of a construction project (design, bidding, construction, and completion stages), achieve refined cost management through BIM technology, requiring accurate integration and analysis of multi-disciplinary, large-scale dynamic data to optimize cost control and improve economic benefits.
solution: This paper proposes a refined cost management solution for construction projects based on BIM technology. Secondly, to address multi-disciplinary conflicts in the design stage, BIM simulation testing and clash detection technology are applied to optimize scheme design through conflict detection, reducing the risk of changes. explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issue of large amounts of data being dispersed across multiple stages, technology0 is used to avoid redundant modeling through 3D model reuse and database integration, ensuring continuity and accuracy in cost decision-making across stages.

For analysis3, considering the efficiency and accuracy issues during the completion stage settlement, utilize technology4 to ensure the speed and accuracy of data review and settlement through 3D Boolean calculations and database queries.

title: Design of a remote control solution for construction machinery based on Netty
requirement: Design of a remote control solution for construction machinery based on Netty Under the conditions of poor communication signals, high requirements for the accuracy of equipment status monitoring, and strict demands for data security, complete the tasks of real-time monitoring and remote control of construction machinery equipment, including functions such as locking, unlocking, real-time location, and operation status updates.
solution: This paper proposes a remote control solution for construction machinery based on Netty. Specifically, first, considering that unstable communication signals may result in commands not being delivered in time, the Netty communication framework is used to monitor the communication status between the device and the platform in real-time. A unique link mechanism ensures that commands can be executed promptly when the signal is restored, and big data distributed processing technology is introduced for data shunting and efficient processing. Second, to address the inefficiency of polling monitoring and the inability to accurately determine the online status of devices in traditional methods, the Netty framework replaces traditional ACC status monitoring to ensure the real-time and accuracy of device status determination. Finally, to meet the needs for data transmission security and privacy protection, the SM2 encryption algorithm is used for asymmetric encryption of transmission commands, including parameters such as the device ID hash value, timestamp, and command type, ensuring data security during transmission. Additionally, combined with intelligent terminal technology (TBOX), the device end can automatically synchronize data with the platform and receive commands after the signal is restored, significantly improving the system's level of automation. This solution has been experimentally validated and outperforms other traditional solutions in terms of execution cycle, performance, and data security, demonstrating significant practical value.

For analysis1, considering the low efficiency of polling monitoring and its reliance on manual intervention, technology0 (Netty communication framework) is used to independently monitor the communication status of each device, replacing the traditional ACC status determination. For analysis2, considering the insecurity of data transmission and potential privacy leakage risks, technology2 (SM2 encryption algorithm) is used to perform asymmetric encryption on the transmission messages. Through the mechanism of public key encryption and private key decryption, data security is ensured to prevent interception or tampering.

title: Design of an Elevator Magnetorheological Fluid Brake Scheme Based on TRIZ Theory and Substance-Field Analysis
requirement: Design of an Elevator Magnetorheological Fluid Brake Scheme Based on TRIZ Theory and Substance-Field Analysis Under the condition of insufficient braking force in the elevator brake, complete the task of improving the safety and functionality of the elevator brake through innovative design and simulation verification.
solution: This paper proposes the design scheme of an elevator magnetohydrodynamic brake. Specifically, first, considering the problem of insufficient friction caused by brake pad wear in elevator brakes, where traditional mechanical fields are difficult to control and may be unstable, the dual-field model technology is used to introduce a second field, namely the magnetic field, enhancing the braking effect of the existing field; second, by adopting a more controllable field substitution technology, the traditional mechanical friction field is replaced with a magnetic field, significantly improving the system's responsiveness and controllability; finally, through magnetohydrodynamic technology, traditional brake pads are replaced with magnetic fluid, and the transition of magnetic fluid between solid and liquid states under a magnetic field is utilized to optimize the braking mechanism into a wear-free design, effectively solving the problem of insufficient friction and enhancing the braking effect. Simulation verification shows that in the power-off state, the magnetic field increases the viscosity of the magnetic fluid, achieving effective braking; in the power-on state, the magnetic field characteristics are adjusted, reducing the viscosity of the magnetic fluid and realizing brake release, thereby achieving the desired functionality.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the challenge of insufficient braking force of the elevator brake due to brake pad wear, which may lead to safety accidents, technology0 was used to introduce a magnetic field enhancement mechanism; technology1 was employed to replace the mechanical field with a more easily controllable magnetic field; meanwhile, technology2 was used to replace traditional brake pads with magnetorheological fluid, leveraging its variable viscosity to achieve an improvement in braking force and solve the wear problem.

title: Micro-renovation design of old communities based on the "open block" concept — Taking the renovation design of Hongpailou Community in Chengdu as an example
requirement: Micro-renovation design of old communities based on the "open block" concept — Taking the renovation design of Hongpailou Community in Chengdu as an example Under the conditions of strong enclosure in old neighborhoods, single-function street facilities, and a lack of regional cultural resources, a micro-renewal transformation of the Hongpailou old community in Chengdu based on an open street block concept aims to optimize the transportation network, create diversified public spaces, integrate the concept of cultural catalysis, and enhance the quality of life and happiness of residents.
solution: This paper proposes a reconstruction plan for the Hongpailou community based on the concept of "open blocks." title: Campus architectural design based on historical style control - Taking the conceptual design of Fuzhou Fangxiang Primary School as an example
requirement: Campus architectural design based on historical style control - Taking the conceptual design of Fuzhou Fangxiang Primary School as an example In the context of protecting the historical heritage of Shangxiahang and Cangxia historical districts in Fuzhou, complete the campus architectural design that combines limiting building height with ensuring the integrity of campus functionality and historical preservation. It is necessary to meet the functional needs of a 24-class public elementary school while achieving the continuation and integration of historical district heritage in terms of architectural texture, space, and form.
solution: This paper proposes an integrated design solution that combines the historical context of the site with the functional requirements of contemporary campus buildings. By splitting building volumes and connecting them with corridors, the new buildings achieve a harmonious scale while meeting functional demands. title: Research on the Design of Foundation Pit Support Scheme Based on Working Condition Factors
requirement: Research on the Design of Foundation Pit Support Scheme Based on Working Condition Factors Under the conditions of a foundation pit with a depth of 4.95–5.40 meters, complex geological layers including fill, clay, silty clay interbedded with silt, the influence of phreatic and confined water, and the surrounding presence of municipal roads, pipelines, and buildings, complete the foundation pit support design and implement construction, ensuring the stability of the foundation pit and the safety of the surrounding environment and buildings.
solution: This paper proposes a foundation pit support scheme combining three forms: 'bored pile + high-pressure jet grouting pile + soil nail wall.' Specifically, firstly, considering the depth of the foundation pit and geological complexity, in the sales office and landscape soil stacking area, the support technology of bored piles combined with high-pressure jet grouting piles (technology0) is used. Through the joint support of bored piles and high-pressure jet grouting piles, high strength and anti-sliding assurance are achieved. Secondly, for areas near pipelines and construction roads, slope cutting + anchor-pulled steel sheet piles (technology1) are adopted. Combined with anchors and steel sheet piles, anti-overturning and anti-uplift capabilities are realized. Finally, in open areas, slope soil nail wall technology (technology2) is chosen. Stability control is achieved through multiple rows of soil nails and slope structure calculations. In addition, to ensure the safety and cost-effectiveness of each part of the support design, the Li Zheng Deep Foundation Pit Support Design Software (technology3) is used for internal force, displacement, and stability verification, validating the economic efficiency and construction reliability of the scheme.

title: Design of a combined flood and waterlogging control solution based on the active water level reduction of the drainage system
requirement: Design of a combined flood and waterlogging control solution based on the active water level reduction of the drainage system Under the conditions of high water levels in the downstream sewage pipeline network in area D, which create a backwater effect on the upstream, loss of storage capacity, and prominent conflicts of internal flooding and pollution, complete the tasks of lowering the water levels in the drainage pipeline network in this area, effectively alleviating flooding issues, reducing the amount of pollutants entering the river, and improving the river's water quality.
solution: This paper proposes a solution based on fuse technology for lowering water levels and simultaneously addressing waterlogging and pollution. Specifically, firstly, to solve the issue of storage capacity loss in the D area sewage pipeline network caused by the backwater effect of high downstream water levels, fuse technology is implemented in the drainage system to cut off the hydraulic connection between the D area and the upstream and downstream municipal sewer, forming an independent drainage area, lowering the water level of the drainage network by more than 1.6m, and restoring the storage capacity of the pipelines. Secondly, to address the frequent gate opening and pollution discharge during light to moderate rainfall under the combined drainage system, sewage lifting pump station retrofitting technology is adopted, modifying the pump station outfall to connect to the downstream main culvert, eliminating the need for frequent gate opening during light to moderate rainfall, reducing the annual gate opening frequency from 83 times to 17 times, and simultaneously reducing COD emissions by 248.4t/year and ammonia nitrogen by 19.7t/year. Lastly, by constructing localized independent drainage areas and lowering the network water level, time is gained for globally resolving the issue of high water levels in the sewage pipeline network of the central cluster, thereby effectively alleviating the waterlogging problem in the D area in the short term and improving the river water quality (elevating it to Class V).

By constructing an independent drainage area, the water level of the drainage pipe network in Area D is reduced by more than 1.6 meters, restoring the storage capacity of the culverts and pipelines.

For analysis1, considering the combined drainage system in area D and the issue of overflow into the river, technology1 is used to retrofit the pressure pipeline of the sewage lifting pump station, directing drainage directly to the downstream main box culvert. This ensures that under moderate and light rain conditions, drainage can be achieved without opening the gate, reducing the number of gate openings from 83 times to 17 times per year, while also decreasing the amount of pollutants entering the river by 248.4 tons/year of COD and 19.7 tons/year of ammonia nitrogen.

For analysis2, considering the difficulty of systematically lowering the water level of the central group pipe network in the short term, technology0 and technology1 are used to implement fusing technology locally and renovate the pumping stations to quickly resolve the local waterlogging issue in area D, thereby gaining time for systematically addressing the overall high water level problem of the sewage system.

title: Design of flood control and drainage planning scheme for coastal mountainous cities based on river basins
requirement: Design of flood control and drainage planning scheme for coastal mountainous cities based on river basins Under the complex coastal mountainous conditions, overcome the issues of alternating floods, tides, and waterlogging to achieve efficient flood control and drainage planning for the basin, urban construction areas, and waterlogging-prone zones. Ensure that under the conditions of a 1-in-20-year heavy rain combined with a 1-in-50-year flood and tide, the 35.06 million m³ of rainfall runoff generated in area Y can be fully discharged, eliminating waterlogging risks.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive planning scheme for flood control and drainage in coastal mountainous cities. Firstly, considering the complex terrain of coastal mountainous areas, high flood peaks, and short durations, the SWMM model and river regulation techniques are used to reserve a flood detention area (8 km²), expand the river channel scale (total length increased to 100.2 km), and regulate runoff discharge to eliminate large-scale flooding. Lastly, tackling the challenge of forced water drainage during extreme weather conditions, six pump stations are configured to ensure a forced drainage capacity of 50.7 m³/s through precise pump station scheduling. Furthermore, SWMM verification shows that the scheme can effectively cope with the conditions of a 30-year return period heavy rain superimposed with a 50-year return period storm surge, with no overflow points occurring, comprehensively enhancing flood control and drainage capabilities.

Regarding analysis1, the current situation lacks sufficient drainage facilities. title: Practice-based research on ecology and traditional context in regional urban design: A case study of the conceptual design for Weihai Coral Sea Habitat Festival.

title: Design of a control scheme for a multi-legged vacuum adsorption robot based on particle swarm optimization and fuzzy PID control
requirement: Design of a control scheme for a multi-legged vacuum adsorption robot based on particle swarm optimization and fuzzy PID control In the time-varying nonlinear system where the wall-climbing robot is affected by gravity, wall surface support force, and adsorption force, achieving high-precision motor speed control of the robot's motion control system requires ensuring fast system response without overshoot to meet the task requirements of the wall-climbing robot.
solution: This paper proposes a motion control scheme for a multi-legged vacuum adsorption robot based on particle swarm optimization and fuzzy PID control. Simulation results verify the effectiveness of the above scheme in meeting the requirements for high-precision motor speed control and rapid response performance.

title: Research on Cost Control in the Scheme Design Stage of Secondary Development Residential Projects Based on Combination Weighting-TOPSIS
requirement: Research on Cost Control in the Scheme Design Stage of Secondary Development Residential Projects Based on Combination Weighting-TOPSIS In the scheme design phase of secondary residential development projects, under the conditions of multiple complex factors affecting cost control, a reasonable index evaluation system is established. solution: This paper proposes a study on cost control during the scheme design stage of secondary development residential projects based on the combined weighting-TOPSIS method. title: Design of a control scheme for household charging equipment based on a clustered management method
requirement: Design of a control scheme for household charging equipment based on a clustered management method Under the conditions of limited load on community distribution transformers, increasing demand for pure electric vehicle charging, diverse user charging behaviors, and potential handshake failures of some vehicles, design and implement a household charging equipment control scheme based on clustered management to meet the maximum charging demand of pure electric vehicles and ensure the stable operation of transformer loads.
solution: This paper proposes a control scheme for household charging devices based on cluster management. Specifically, first, considering the issue that the limited load of community distribution transformers may lead to transformer overload and the inability of equipment to work in coordination, the cluster management technology is adopted to uniformly regulate all charging devices to meet the charging needs of all vehicles within the safe load. Second, to address the problem of uneven resource allocation caused by differences in user charging demands, a charging demand grading technique is introduced, categorizing vehicles into three levels: urgent charging, moderate demand, and general demand. Finally, to tackle the problem of failure to charge caused by handshake failures during charging switches, a multiple charging state-switching technique is employed. By dynamically adjusting the charging state, it ensures that every vehicle has the opportunity to charge while maintaining the stable operation of the transformer. This scheme provides an efficient and intelligent solution to the problems of charging pile resource constraints and load limitations brought about by the increase in electric vehicles.

For analysis1, considering that differences in user charging behaviors may lead to uneven resource allocation, the charging demand classification technology using technology1 divides vehicle charging into three levels and optimizes resource allocation through classification to maximize the utilization of charging equipment and transformer capacity.

For analysis2, considering the risk of handshake failure during the charging switching process, the technology2 multi-charging state switching technique is utilized. By dynamically adjusting the level and status of charging vehicles, it fulfills the charging needs of all vehicles without exceeding the safe load and reduces the risk of interruptions.

title: Research on the design of dewatering schemes for foundation pits under complex geological conditions
requirement: Research on the design of dewatering schemes for foundation pits under complex geological conditions Under the conditions of the Yangtze River floodplain landform, strong permeability of aquifers, heavy rainfall, and large precipitation, complete the dewatering project for the deep foundation pit of the third phase of a guaranteed housing construction project in Nanjing, ensuring that the groundwater level of the pit meets design requirements, while controlling the surrounding environmental impact to avoid pit instability and ground settlement issues.
solution: This paper proposes a semi-enclosed dewatering scheme for foundation pits based on complex geological conditions and hydrological environments. Specifically, firstly, considering the highly permeable aquifer conditions within the complex landforms of the Yangtze River floodplain, which may result in difficulties in dewatering, a combination of cutoff wall technology and wellpoint dewatering design is adopted to effectively isolate the hydraulic connection between the inside and outside of the foundation pit, lowering the water table below the bottom of the pit. Secondly, to address water level fluctuations caused by the rainy climate, pit bottom reinforcement technology and drainage system design are employed to strengthen the control of potential geological and environmental risks. Meanwhile, to verify the feasibility and safety of the scheme, GMS Modflow software is used to conduct a three-dimensional simulation analysis of the groundwater dewatering effect, ensuring the stability and reliability of the dewatering design. Finally, to mitigate potential risks during construction, foundation pit monitoring technology is utilized for real-time dynamic monitoring and adjustments, ensuring environmental stability throughout the dewatering and construction periods, thus providing a safeguard for the successful implementation of the project.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the complex aquifer conditions and strong permeability in the Yangtze River floodplain's intricate geomorphology, which may result in an inability to lower the water level within the excavation, the technology0 cut-off curtain technique was adopted to construct a semi-enclosed excavation structure, significantly reducing the hydraulic connection between the inside and outside of the excavation. At the same time, a technology1 wellpoint dewatering design was used to lower the groundwater level to 0.5m below the excavation bottom, effectively enabling drainage and achieving the dewatering of the excavation.

For analysis1, considering that heavy and continuous rainfall may cause severe water level fluctuations inside and outside the foundation pit and create drainage difficulties, technology2 is used to reinforce the pit bottom to improve soil stability. Meanwhile, by dynamically adjusting wellpoint dewatering and combining open ditches with sump drainage methods, the timely removal of rainwater recharge is enhanced to ensure the normal water level inside the foundation pit.

Combining the above precipitation conditions, to evaluate the effectiveness of the semi-enclosed precipitation scheme, the GMS Modflow software of technology3 is used to construct a three-dimensional groundwater model to simulate the precipitation effect and the impact of dewatering the foundation pit on the surrounding area, and to verify the safety of the scheme.

To ensure the safety of the foundation pit and the stability of the surrounding environment during construction, technology4's foundation pit monitoring technology is adopted. By monitoring water levels, settlement, and support conditions in real-time, timely warnings and emergency measures are taken to ensure the safety and reliability of the construction process.

title: Research on the architectural design of multi-main transformer all-indoor substations.
requirement: Research on the architectural design of multi-main transformer all-indoor substations. solution: This paper proposes an architectural design scheme for unconventional fully indoor substations with multiple main transformers. Specifically, firstly, considering the issues of increasing power load and complex functional room organization, the planar layout optimization and integration technology is employed. By adopting a lateral three-section functional division and a linear arrangement method, efficient equipment utilization and compact layouts are achieved. Secondly, to address issues like exceeding the fire partition standards in the underground cable layer, an automatic fire extinguishing system for the underground cable layer is introduced, expanding the fire partition limit to 2000m², thereby ensuring the building's fire safety. Additionally, to resolve the problem of complicated evacuation flowlines caused by increased building size, the evacuation flowline is optimized through design by setting up centrally arranged evacuation corridors and layered staircases to avoid flowline intersections. Finally, to reduce the electromagnetic radiation and noise impact on the environment, green building design techniques are applied, utilizing simple building volumes combined with regional landscaping to achieve an organic integration of the building with its surroundings, while simultaneously enhancing the aesthetic value of the functional areas.

title: Design and Stability Prediction Research on Multi-Level High Slope Combined Support Scheme
requirement: Design and Stability Prediction Research on Multi-Level High Slope Combined Support Scheme Under the conditions of complex geological conditions, limited construction space, multi-level high slopes, and various forms of support, design and construct slopes ranging from 1.5 to 29.5 meters on the site, complete permanent reinforcement treatment, and predict slope stability based on the LightGBM algorithm to ensure slope stability safety and construction coordination.
solution: This paper proposes a solution for the support and stability prediction of complex multi-level slopes. Specifically, first, considering the site complexity and construction space constraints, gravity retaining wall technology and inclined retaining wall technology are used to achieve stable support for the fill slope segment through systematic support design. Second, in response to the complex geological conditions and soil layer differences, anchor bolt and prestressed anchor cable technology, as well as support pile technology, are adopted to support the stability of excavation slopes using a stepped support scheme. Finally, for slope stability prediction and analysis, a model is constructed based on the LightGBM algorithm to analyze the key factors affecting slope stability, with feature importance analysis identifying soil cohesion and slope angle as the most critical factors. The final solution yielded a stability probability of 0.9 and an instability probability of only 0.1 in the stability evaluation of the northern slope, verifying the safety and practical value of the solution.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the narrow construction space and significant height difference of the slope, which may lead to high construction difficulty, technology0 and technology1 were used. Through the techniques of gravity retaining walls and inclined retaining walls, stable support for the slope fill section was achieved.

For analysis1, considering the various soil layer geological conditions and mechanical differences that may increase the risk of support failure, technology2 and technology3 are used. By combining anchor rods and prestressed anchor cable with support pile technology, the complex geological conditions are effectively supported.

For analysis2, considering the design complexity and construction coordination difficulties, focus on using the combined technology of technology3 rotary drilling piles and manually excavated piles, while integrating the design with the foundation pit structure to ensure the cost-effectiveness and safety of slope support.

title: Discussion on the Scheme Design of Large-Scale LNG Emergency Peak-Shaving Stations
requirement: Discussion on the Scheme Design of Large-Scale LNG Emergency Peak-Shaving Stations Under the current fluctuations in natural gas supply and demand and the context of the dual-carbon policy, ensure the security of natural gas supply in Hefei by designing a large-scale LNG emergency peak-shaving station, addressing various gasification load conditions and BOG management requirements.
solution: This paper proposes a design plan for a large-scale LNG emergency peak shaving station in Hefei. Specifically, first, combining the gas demand at different stages, a submerged combustion vaporizer (SCV) is adopted, with an operational efficiency exceeding 95%, and peak demand is met by flexibly adjusting vaporization capacity. Second, to address the issue of high BOG (Boil-Off Gas) production, a direct pressurization output process is used, along with medium-pressure and high-pressure transmission methods and a flare system to consume excess evaporated gas, ensuring operational safety and stable natural gas supply. Finally, the rapid response feature of the SCV is utilized to guarantee safe supply and vaporization efficiency during extreme winter weather and rapid load changes, providing an efficient and stable solution.

For analysis1, considering that the high production of BOG may affect the operational safety of the station, technology1 is adopted. Through the direct pressurization output process, BOG is transported separately to medium-pressure and high-pressure pipelines, alleviating overpressure problems and efficiently utilizing evaporated gas.

For analysis2, considering rapid load changes and gasification demands, use technology0's SCV as the core equipment, while flexibly adjusting its gasification capacity range to respond to rapid peak shaving and extreme weather gas supply demands.

title: Design and implementation of health monitoring solutions for large public buildings
requirement: Design and implementation of health monitoring solutions for large public buildings Under the conditions of a complex building structure (reinforced concrete frame-shear wall structural system), multifunctional use (laboratories and offices), and complex environmental wind loads, complete the design and implementation of a health monitoring system for this large public building. The monitoring content includes stress, wind speed and direction, seismic response, and floor vibration, among others.
solution: This paper proposes a design and implementation plan for health monitoring of large public buildings. Specifically, first, considering the detection requirements for complex structures and seismic responses, strain monitoring and embedded strain gauge technology, as well as seismic acceleration response monitoring technology, are utilized. Through the rational arrangement of strain gauges and acceleration sensors, efficient monitoring of stress on key components and seismic response characteristics is achieved. Second, addressing floor vibrations caused by large equipment, floor vibration monitoring technology is employed. By arranging vibration sensors in the experimental zone, the impact of instruments is scientifically assessed. Third, in the face of complex wind load challenges, wind speed, wind direction, and wind pressure sensor deployment technology is used. Based on simulation analysis, sensors are arranged to acquire wind load data. Finally, a BIM-based early warning monitoring system is developed, providing scientific technical support for building operation and safety maintenance through real-time data collection, visualization, and health warning functions.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the challenges of complex structures and the need for precise monitoring of seismic responses, technology0 (strain monitoring and pre-embedded strain gauge technology) and technology2 (seismic acceleration response monitoring technology) were used. By arranging transfer trusses, column strain gauges, and multi-layer acceleration sensors, key stress changes and seismic response characteristics were successfully identified.

For analysis1, considering the challenge that large equipment causing floor vibrations may affect structural performance, technology3 (floor vibration monitoring technology) is adopted. By placing vibration monitoring points to collect floor vibration data, the structural impact of equipment vibrations is accurately assessed.

For analysis2, considering the monitoring needs of complex wind loads and fluctuating wind fields, use technology1 (wind speed, wind direction, and wind pressure sensor arrangement technology) to arrange wind speed and wind pressure measurement points based on wind field numerical simulation, accurately collecting building wind load data.

title: Design of the machining plan for the boom of a large excavator on a medium-sized CNC double-head boring machine.
requirement: Design of the machining plan for the boom of a large excavator on a medium-sized CNC double-head boring machine. On a medium-sized CNC double-head boring machine, process the boom of a large excavator to ensure that the rear shaft seat hole, boom cylinder support sleeve hole, front-end head hole, and arm cylinder support ear hole simultaneously meet the geometric tolerance requirements, address the issue of axis line intersection caused by welding deformation, and ensure that all hole distances and hole surface machining accuracy comply with the design drawing requirements.
solution: This paper proposes a machining solution for the boom of large excavators on a medium-sized CNC facing boring machine. Specifically, first, considering the axis crossing issue caused by welding deformation, the tapered positioning pin technology is adopted to quickly achieve boom centerline correction through automatic misalignment compensation and centering functions. Second, to address the difficulties in positioning large-volume workpieces and meeting machining accuracy requirements, special machining fixtures are designed, achieving quick boom clamping and machining accuracy control through a high-precision base frame and support plates for stable locking. Finally, for two sets of associated hole systems requiring sequential machining, sequential clamping and machining technology is adopted in combination with hoisting ropes and plumb line correction technology. The two-stage machining of the boom is completed using distance spacers and plumb line center calibration. This solution significantly shortens clamping and correction time, improves the machining efficiency and accuracy of the boom, and provides an innovative solution for the boring machining of similar engineering machinery booms.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issue of axis misalignment caused by welding deformation, the conical positioning screw pin in technology0 is used. Through the automatic centering function of the conical surface, rapid correction is achieved, solving the problems of complex clamping and excessive calibration time.

For analysis1, considering the positioning problem caused by machining long-stroke workpieces with a medium-sized facing and boring machine, a specialized machining fixture designed with technology2 was adopted. By aligning with the centerline of the base frame and using stable screw pin locking, the issues of unstable workpiece positioning and difficulty in controlling machining accuracy were resolved.

title: Design and analysis of a long-span irregular spatial steel structure connecting scheme
requirement: Design and analysis of a long-span irregular spatial steel structure connecting scheme In the design of the large-span irregular connected structure with a span of 81.92 meters and a main height of 35.4 meters, complete the reasonable connection between the connected structure and the main structures at both ends, ensuring that the connected structure meets the requirements for load-bearing capacity, overall stability, and safety, while achieving a novel and aesthetically pleasing architectural effect.
solution: This paper proposes a solution for the design and analysis of long-span irregular steel structure connection schemes. Specifically, firstly, considering the large span and irregular plane shape of the connected structure, an orthogonal grid structure is adopted. By optimizing the arrangement and dimensions of the members, uniform stress distribution is achieved, and overall stability is improved. Secondly, addressing potential connection issues caused by low stiffness of the connected structure and temperature effects, flexible connection technology is employed, using bi-directional sliding supports to reduce seismic coupling effects and the impact of temperature deformation. Thirdly, to resolve the issue of water accumulation potentially caused by mid-span deflection, pre-cambering technology is utilized, combined with refined linear buckling and nonlinear stability analysis, ensuring that the mid-span deflection meets standards and allows smooth drainage. Finally, for local issues such as insufficient bearing capacity of straight edge supports, reinforcement design and optimization of the stress distribution at nodes are applied to ensure local stress safety. The overall solution integrates safety, economy, and rationality, achieving an organic combination of architectural aesthetics and functionality.

By optimizing the arrangement of members and the design of grid dimensions, achieve overall coordinated deformation and uniform stress distribution, avoiding stability issues caused by uneven stress.

title: Solar Photovoltaic and Photothermal Residential Building Integration (BIPVT) Scheme Design and Research
requirement: Solar Photovoltaic and Photothermal Residential Building Integration (BIPVT) Scheme Design and Research Under the conditions of increasing building energy consumption, high consumption of centralized energy supply modes, and the integration of photovoltaic/thermal components' photothermal and photovoltaic demands, complete the construction task of solar photovoltaic/thermal integrated residential buildings (BIPVT) to achieve building energy consumption optimization and efficient solar energy conversion and utilization.
solution: This paper proposes a design scheme for the integration of photovoltaic and photothermal solar residential buildings (BIPVT). Specifically, firstly, considering the issues of increased building energy consumption and high indoor thermal environment demands, PV/T photovoltaic and photothermal integrated components and photovoltaic phase change thermal storage energy-saving wall systems are used to enhance thermal efficiency through the integration of photovoltaic power generation and heat recovery. Secondly, in response to the high consumption problem of centralized energy supply models, flat-panel PV/T components and BIPV/T integration models are applied to reduce long-distance energy consumption and transportation losses through distributed design. Finally, to address the balance between the photothermal efficiency and photovoltaic efficiency of PV/T components, high-performance flat-panel PV/T components are adopted, and overall performance improvement is achieved by optimizing the photovoltaic enclosure structure. In addition, combined with the design of a vertically greened surrounding environment, solar energy absorption efficiency, energy-saving effects, and building comfort are enhanced, realizing the integration of new energy utilization and ecological synergy in the construction field.

title: Research on Ultra-Low Energy Consumption Rural Housing Design and Suitable Technologies in Ningxia Region — A Case Study of Hongde Village, Wuzhong City

By optimizing building layout and design, improving the insulation performance of the envelope structure, and fully utilizing the region's abundant solar energy resources, significant energy efficiency optimization was achieved, enhancing the quality of life for the residents.

title: Concept and exploration of the design scheme for the office building of a People's Procuratorate in a certain county of Ankang City.

title: The impact of installation torque on the post-anchorage bearing capacity and scheme design
requirement: The impact of installation torque on the post-anchorage bearing capacity and scheme design Taking into account the influence of installation torque on anchor bolt preload and foundation splitting force, the boundary condition requirements (edge distance, spacing, base material thickness), and the thickness of the anti-corrosion coating, complete the post-anchoring installation of the anchor bolts and ensure the safety of the system's load-bearing capacity.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive technical and design solution for post-anchoring installation. Specifically, firstly, considering the issues caused by excessive or insufficient installation torque, torque and pre-tightening force control technology is adopted to accurately calculate installation parameters and ensure the safe operation of the anchor bolts. Secondly, to address the cracking of the base material caused by insufficient edge distance, spacing, and thickness, the minimum spacing, edge distance, and embedding depth are optimized, and damage is avoided by adapting to actual torque values. Then, to mitigate the losses caused by the creep of chemical anchors, the curing time is extended, and pre-tightening force compensation is added to maintain the load-bearing capacity of the anchors. For installation issues caused by anti-corrosion coatings, spacing and edge distance are increased, and the adjustment of installation parameters is used to prevent base material cracking. Finally, for scenarios involving cracks in the base material, secondary expansion technology is employed to restore load-bearing capacity through extrusion and mechanical interlocking. The effectiveness of the solution is validated through example designs, providing detailed references for engineering applications.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the damage that may be caused by excessive or insufficient installation torque, technology0 is adopted to control installation parameters through preload and torque calculations, ensuring the safe operation of the anchor bolts.

For analysis1, considering that insufficient margins, spacing, and substrate thickness may lead to splitting failure, use technology1 to optimize the design of minimum spacing, margins, and embedment depth to prevent substrate cracking.

For analysis2, considering that the creep phenomenon of chemical anchor bolts may reduce the pre-tightening force, technology2 is adopted to maintain the bearing capacity of the anchor bolts by controlling the curing time and adding pre-tightening force compensation.

For analysis3, to address the issue of reduced friction coefficient caused by the addition of anti-corrosion coatings, use technology3 to optimize spacing, margins, and installation torque, avoiding substrate damage caused by the coating effect.

For analysis4, considering the issue of rapid pretension decay caused by substrate cracking, technology4 is adopted to restore or enhance the anchor bolt's bearing capacity through secondary expansion technology.

title: Exploration of the Design and Construction Key Points for Mountainous Area Sewage Pipelines
requirement: Exploration of the Design and Construction Key Points for Mountainous Area Sewage Pipelines Under the conditions of the mountainous terrain in a Yi-Dai Autonomous County in Yuxi City, Yunnan Province, design and construct the sewage pipeline network, including overhead pipelines and direct-buried pipelines, to ensure the sustainability of sewage discharge, meet the annual water use and sewage discharge needs of 30,000 permanent residents, and ensure the stability and durability of the pipelines.
solution: This paper proposes the design and construction plan for sewage pipelines in the mountainous areas of Yuxi, Yunnan. Specifically, firstly, considering the complex terrain and steep slopes of the mountainous area, fiberglass reinforced sand pipes, steel truss wiring, and cantilevered transport equipment are used to ensure the stability of pipeline installation and construction efficiency. Secondly, to meet the diverse demands of increasing domestic sewage discharge over time, a partial-flow design is adopted, enhancing drainage capacity and adapting to extreme demands by adjusting pipe diameter, flow velocity, and filling range. Lastly, to address potential poor soil foundation issues with some directly buried pipelines, plain concrete or medium-coarse sand bedding is used to optimize the foundation, effectively improving the durability and safety of the pipelines. At the same time, for pipeline construction on steep mountain walls, a complete drainage pipeline system combining embedded parts with steel structure truss systems and gravity support piers is developed, ensuring the sustainability and economic efficiency of the project.

title: Sustainable office space design plan for Guojin Building in Jincheng, Shanxi

title: Design and construction of the integrated cabling solution for the mechanical and electrical systems of industrial plants
requirement: Design and construction of the integrated cabling solution for the mechanical and electrical systems of industrial plants Under the conditions of large-scale partitioning with complex functions, high wiring demands, and a special environment, complete the comprehensive electromechanical wiring tasks for the industrial plant, ensuring the reliability, scalability, and construction precision of the wiring plan, while addressing the issues of safety and stability in power supply and signal transmission.
solution: This paper proposes an integrated electromechanical wiring solution for industrial buildings with complex functionality, large scale, and harsh environmental conditions. Lastly, to tackle issues of humid environments as well as power and communication safety, modular wiring and grounding protection measures are implemented, combined with cable protection solutions for humid environments. Multi-point grounding and dehumidifying measures are used to ensure the overall system's safety and stability.

title: Design and Considerations for the Diversion Renovation Plan of Municipal Rainwater and Sewage Pipe Networks

solution: This paper proposes a diversion renovation plan for municipal stormwater and sewage pipe networks. Specifically, first, to address the issue of mixed stormwater and sewage connection points in the current situation, considering the complexity of the existing drainage pipe network distribution, the diversion of the drainage system was achieved by using the reconnection technology of the two existing drainage systems, investigating mixed connection points, and combining pipe restoration. Secondly, to tackle the problems of high loads on sewage treatment plants during the rainy season and insufficient capacity of the combined pipe network, diversion renovation technology for the combined drainage system was used, preserving the combined system and constructing new pipelines to ensure complete separation of stormwater and sewage. Thirdly, to address the challenges of underground culverts and complex drainage in covered ditches, underground culvert diversion technology and covered ditch renovation technology were applied to categorize and renovate various facilities, ensuring existing drainage functions while upgrading the system. Finally, integrating the sponge city concept, the renovation process optimized the design of pavement, green spaces, and median strips, using permeable facilities and bio-retention facilities to reduce runoff, ultimately enhancing the overall renovation effectiveness.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the difficulty of completely separating the rainwater and sewage connection points, use technology0 to identify the mixed connection points in the current drainage system. title: Design and static analysis of the balance arm ear plate scheme for a flat-top tower crane
requirement: Design and static analysis of the balance arm ear plate scheme for a flat-top tower crane Under the conditions where the pulling direction of the tie rod does not coincide with the axis of the lug plate, the dimensions and thickness of the lug plate need reasonable adjustment, and the design angle of the lug plate is constrained, complete the optimization plan design and static analysis of the lug plate for the flat-top tower crane balance arm to ensure uniform force distribution, safety, and reliability of the lug plate.
solution: This paper proposes an optimization scheme for the balance arm ear plates of flat-top tower cranes. Specifically, firstly, considering that the misalignment between the direction of the rod tension and the axis of the ear plate may increase shear stress and bending stress, a design aligning the ear plate with the rod axis and an optimized wedge-shaped ear plate design are adopted. This improves the mechanical performance of the ear plate by reducing stress types and mitigating local stress concentration. Secondly, to address the stress concentration issues caused by the size and thickness of the ear plate holes, an optimized wedge-shaped ear plate structure design is employed in combination with finite element simulation analysis, ensuring through scientific calculations that the tensile and shear strength of the ear plate meet design requirements. Finally, to resolve potential balance issues stemming from insufficient ear plate angle design, the installation angle of the ear plate is optimized to 14°, enhancing the uniformity of force distribution and fatigue resistance of the ear plate, thereby ensuring the safety and stability of the tower crane during operation.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the direction of the tie rod is not aligned with the axis of the ear plate, resulting in complex stress, technology0 and technology1 are adopted. title: Discussion on the Design of Prefabricated Temporary Fencing Scheme for Construction Projects

title: Design of the water supply scheme for the separation of town areas in the Jianyang District urban-rural integrated water supply project
requirement: Design of the water supply scheme for the separation of town areas in the Jianyang District urban-rural integrated water supply project Under the actual topographical characteristics and water supply demand conditions of Huangkeng Town, Jianyang District, complete the design of the integrated urban-rural water supply project with a supply scale of 2600 m³/d, specifying the location of the water source points, water treatment processes, pipeline specifications and layout, booster pump stations, and auxiliary facilities, ensuring compliance with flood control standards and achieving long-term stable water supply.
solution: This paper proposes an integrated urban and rural water supply project plan for the zoned water supply in Huangkeng Town. Specifically, first, considering factors influencing the water source, Option 1 was selected due to its better water quality and minimal impact downstream, with a post-dam water intake method used and a filter screen set up to prevent blockages from fallen leaves. Secondly, given the complex mountainous terrain, the water transmission pipeline combines ductile iron pipes and PE pipes, with a reasonable allocation of pipe materials to meet different pipe diameter requirements. title: Design and evaluation of protective solutions for concrete substrates in strong saline-alkaline environments
requirement: Design and evaluation of protective solutions for concrete substrates in strong saline-alkaline environments In a strong saline-alkali environment, develop a protection plan for concrete substrates and steel structures by analyzing the corrosive environment, aiming to achieve long-term effective anti-corrosion performance (with a lifespan of over 15 years).
solution: This paper proposes two protective solutions for environments with strong saline-alkaline soils. solution: This paper proposes the renovation and continuation plan for the East Tower structure of the ultra-high-rise Xuzhou Deji Plaza. title: Design of the Crack Treatment Plan for the Basement Floor Slab of Building Construction Projects
requirement: Design of the Crack Treatment Plan for the Basement Floor Slab of Building Construction Projects Under the conditions where the basement floor has various crack conditions of different widths and depths, and is influenced by factors such as temperature and shrinkage deformation, complete the task of crack sealing to ensure that the strength, durability, and functional requirements of the basement floor meet the original design specifications, including being dry, free from water leakage, and without damaging the original concrete structure. The crack treatment method should be adapted to the characteristics of the cracks and environmental factors.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive treatment plan for basement floor cracks. Specifically, first, considering the complexity of crack distribution and the varying widths and depths, a classification treatment method is adopted: for cracks with a width ≤2 mm, polyurethane leakage sealing technology is applied, utilizing high-pressure grouting and the rapid expansion characteristics of polyurethane materials to achieve rapid crack filling and water-stopping effects; for cracks with a width >2 mm, epoxy resin grouting technology is used, leveraging the high bonding strength and compressive properties of epoxy resin to enhance the concrete strength and durability. Secondly, for the issue of deep crack sealing, hydrophobic polyurethane foam material (width ≤2 mm) or epoxy resin material (width >2 mm) is selected to ensure the treatment effect at the interface between the bedrock and the floor. Finally, by conducting core sampling to test the compactness of the crack treatment, compressive strength, and the grouting effect at the bedrock interface, the effectiveness and compliance of the treatment plan with design requirements are validated.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that cracks are distributed at the base slab and the underground diaphragm wall, as well as the middle of the base slab, and that some cracks have water leakage issues, to address the difficulties in accurate positioning and unstable water-stopping effects, technology0—polyurethane leak sealing technology—was used. Through high-pressure grouting for leak sealing, the material diffuses and fills along the cracks, achieving better water-stopping results while reducing the risk of crack propagation.

For analysis1, considering the different material adaptation requirements for varying crack widths, polyurethane leak sealing technology (technology0) is used for cracks with a width ≤ 2 mm to achieve quick filling and sealing of the cracks; for cracks with a width > 2 mm, epoxy resin grouting technology (technology1) is applied to provide sufficient bonding strength and compressive performance, enhancing the sealing effect of the cracks and the overall strength of the concrete.

For analysis2, to address the issues of difficulty in deep filling and poor sealing effect caused by deep fractures and fracture connectivity, for cracks with a width ≤ 2 mm, the rapid expansion characteristics of technology0 are used to achieve deep fracture sealing; for cracks with a width > 2 mm, technology1 is used to enable material penetration into the deep fractures and enhance the bonding strength between the bedrock and the base interface.

title: Simulation optimization for the design of the material distribution scheme in the excavator boom welding production line

title: Analysis of Architectural Design for Cultural and Sports Centers: A Case Study of the Anxi County Workers' Cultural Palace Schematic Design
requirement: Analysis of Architectural Design for Cultural and Sports Centers: A Case Study of the Anxi County Workers' Cultural Palace Schematic Design Under the conditions of a mountainous site with significant elevation differences, narrow and elongated usable land, and complex functions, complete the architectural design of the Anxi County Workers' Cultural Palace, meeting the comprehensive usage requirements for sports, culture, and services, while ensuring the organic integration of the building with the natural environment and the city.
solution: This article proposes an architectural design plan for the Anxi County Workers' Cultural Palace under the conditions of a mountainous site with significant elevation differences, narrow effective land use, and complex functions. title: Analysis of the causes of abnormal vibrations in construction hoists and design of vibration reduction solutions
requirement: Analysis of the causes of abnormal vibrations in construction hoists and design of vibration reduction solutions Under the conditions of vibration and uneven load distribution caused by gear and rack meshing, design a vibration reduction plan for the construction elevator to reduce abnormal vibration amplitude, improve operational stability, and extend the gear's service life.
solution: This paper proposes a systematic vibration reduction solution for the vibration problem caused by the meshing of gears and racks in construction hoists. Specifically, first, considering the potential wear problems during gear meshing, a running-in process is adopted, gradually increasing the load and smoothing the gear surface to optimize contact accuracy in the early operational stages and slow down the wear process. Second, to address the issue of uneven load distribution, a chain transmission load distribution device is applied, achieving even load distribution through synchronized rotation of the sprockets, thereby reducing the risk of overload wear on individual gears. Lastly, to reduce transmission vibrations, nylon damping wheels and backlash-eliminating gear mechanisms are employed in sequence, where nylon damping wheels mitigate vibration propagation due to their high damping properties, and the backlash-eliminating gear eliminates side clearance through a double-gear tensioning design, ensuring a stable transmission process. This solution provides valuable references and practical experience for future vibration reduction designs in similar construction hoists.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that gear wear will accelerate and cause vibration, use the technology0 running-in process. Through appropriate operation time and gradually increasing load, the initial asperities on the tooth surface are gradually smoothed, improving contact accuracy and reducing abnormal wear.

For analysis1, considering that uneven load distribution will accelerate localized gear wear, the technology1 chain transmission load distribution device is used. By synchronizing the rotation of 3 gears, the load is evenly distributed across all gears, avoiding excessive stress on a single gear and thereby reducing vibration.

For analysis2, considering that gear backlash may cause transmission errors and vibration issues, technology2 nylon damping wheels and technology3 anti-backlash gear structures are adopted. High damping materials reduce vibration response, and tensioning the dual gears prevents idle vibration fluctuations caused by backlash.

title: Scheme design and evaluation of the inorganic quartz stone paving effect
requirement: Scheme design and evaluation of the inorganic quartz stone paving effect In the paving of inorganic quartz stone, based on different bottom surface treatment methods and bonding materials, complete the study and evaluation of bonding strength and dimensional stability, and design and validate the optimal paving solution to improve bonding effectiveness and dimensional stability.
solution: This paper proposes the optimal design and evaluation for the paving effect of inorganic quartz stone. Specifically, first, considering that different base treatment methods and bonding materials may lead to bonding strength issues, the six-side protection process is applied by coating the base with a sealer and spreading standard sand (technology0), effectively increasing the bonding strength to 0.33 MPa. Secondly, using the grinding method on the protective layer of the base (technology1) can also improve bonding strength under certain conditions, but further research is needed on its potential deterioration. Finally, regarding the impact of humidity differences in paving construction on dimensional stability, it is demonstrated that soaking in water to allow uniform moisture absorption on all six sides (technology2) can reduce warping, thereby improving dimensional stability. Through this design and experiment, the paper summarizes key performance optimization measures and construction recommendations for achieving the best paving effect of inorganic quartz stone.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the significant impact of the base surface treatment method and the type of bonding material on bonding strength, technology0 was used to effectively enhance the bonding strength through six-sided protective treatment. Additionally, applying an extra layer of sealant on the base surface and spreading standard sand further optimized the bonding effect.

For analysis0, considering that removing the protective layer may directly improve the bonding effect, technology1 was used to grind the bottom protective layer, which also enhanced the bonding strength. However, further research is needed on potential pathological phenomena such as water stains and rust spots.

For analysis1, considering the warping issue that may arise from one-sided moisture exposure of inorganic quartz during installation, technology2 was used to demonstrate that soaking in water (causing uniform moisture exposure on six sides) can reduce dimensional changes, indicating that moisture balance has a positive effect on dimensional stability.

title: Design of the support scheme for a deep foundation pit in soft soil at a certain site in Kunming
requirement: Design of the support scheme for a deep foundation pit in soft soil at a certain site in Kunming Under the conditions of soft strata, high groundwater levels, a complex surrounding environment, and a large excavation volume, complete the deep foundation pit support design and construction for a certain plot in Yinhai Bo'an, Kunming, ensuring the stability of the foundation pit, the safety of surrounding facilities, and the continuity of construction.

title: A brief analysis of the design scheme for intelligent sanitation robots in scenic areas

title: Study on the Scheme Design of the Energy Center for a Regional Hub Airport
requirement: Study on the Scheme Design of the Energy Center for a Regional Hub Airport Under the conditions of insufficient current energy station capacity, limited land use, high building cooling and heating loads, and strict requirements for energy conservation and emission reduction, complete the design and construction tasks for the energy center of the new terminal building, comprehensive transportation center, and overnight passenger accommodations at the regional hub airport. This must achieve efficient energy utilization, meet load demands, reduce operating costs, and comply with carbon peaking and green development requirements.
solution: This paper proposes a construction plan for a regional hub airport energy center that integrates the complex demands of new buildings with green development goals. Specifically, first, considering the problem of insufficient capacity in the existing energy station, a natural gas combined cooling, heating, and power (CCHP) system is adopted, improving energy utilization efficiency through reasonable design of operating parameters and generator capacity. Second, addressing the high load of new buildings, a water-based cold storage system is combined with distributed natural gas energy, storing energy during off-peak electricity pricing hours, and supplying cooling during peak times to reduce operating costs. In addition, to achieve energy-saving and emission-reduction goals, flue gas hot water-type lithium bromide absorption chillers and gas boilers are used, effectively reducing carbon emissions through a combination of waste heat recovery and auxiliary heating. Finally, the design of additional centrifugal chillers, optimized for day and night load variations, ensures more stable and reliable cooling supply for the system. Overall, this solution integrates various energy sources to enhance the efficiency of the energy supply system, reduce annual operating costs, achieve energy conservation and emission reduction, and ensure diverse and complementary energy use, meeting the established task objectives.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the insufficient energy supply capacity of the current energy station and the land constraints, technology0 is adopted to construct a natural gas combined cooling, heating, and power (CCHP) system. For analysis1, considering the high-load heating, cooling, and power demands of new buildings, a combination of technology0 and technology1 is used. For analysis1 and analysis2, through the design of the centrifugal chiller unit of technology4, combined with the characteristics of day and night loads, optimize the utilization of the cooling source to further enhance the operational efficiency of the entire energy center, and reduce energy consumption and operating costs.

title: Design and analysis of a cooling supply scheme for a regional energy station
requirement: Design and analysis of a cooling supply scheme for a regional energy station Under the conditions of high daytime load, low nighttime load, and gradually increasing load demand at the energy station, design an efficient and economical cooling solution to meet the varying cooling load demands of complex building types, while achieving the goals of "peak shaving and valley filling" and economic investment returns.
solution: This paper proposes a regional energy station cooling solution centered on an ice storage system. Specifically, firstly, considering the situation of high cooling load during the day and low load at night, the ice storage system is used to reduce installed capacity by supplying cooling through ice melting during peak periods and storing ice during off-peak periods, achieving a goal of approximately 27.4% reduction in equipment investment. Secondly, to address the issue of significant differences in building types and cooling demands, a dual-condition centrifugal chiller unit is adopted to meet diverse needs through its flexibility in ice-making and cooling. Finally, considering the actual situation of increasing energy station loads year by year, combined with peak-valley electricity price strategies, the ice storage technology is used to maximize electricity price economic benefits, with phased operation strategies established to adapt to the progressively increasing load demands. This solution, based on "peak shaving and valley filling," saves 5.96 million RMB in annual operating costs compared to conventional air conditioning systems, providing an important reference for similar cases.

By reducing the installed capacity of the chiller unit and partially using ice melting for cooling during peak periods, the goals of reducing equipment investment and achieving efficient system operation were realized.

For analysis1, considering the diversity of building types and fluctuations in load demand, technology1 dual-condition centrifugal chillers are used. Through its dual-condition characteristics of ice-making and cooling, it adapts to the cooling demands during daytime peaks and low nighttime loads, ensuring system operation adaptability.

For analysis2, considering the annual load increase and the long-term operational efficiency requirements of the energy station, technology0 and technology2 are adopted. By utilizing the ice storage system combined with the peak-valley electricity price strategy, a phased and flexible operation mode is designed to both ensure the annual load matching requirements and achieve an improvement in economic return rates.

title: Design analysis of the foundation plan for an external swirl pool trestle column
requirement: Design analysis of the foundation plan for an external swirl pool trestle column Under the conditions of large-scale excavation of the swirl tank and foundation disturbance, complete the design and construction tasks of the open-air trestle column foundation, ensuring that the foundation meets the tilt limit of the bridge crane track surface and the load capacity requirements, while also reducing the construction period and overall cost.
solution: This paper proposes a design plan for the pillar foundation of an open-air trestle under the conditions of large-scale excavation and severe foundation disturbance. Specifically, firstly, considering that large-scale excavation disturbance may result in the backfilled soil layers failing to meet bearing capacity requirements and increased construction difficulty, a natural foundation solution is adopted, optimizing the foundation size to directly design the bearing layer into moderately weathered sandstone. Secondly, to address issues such as the difficulty in eliminating foundation pit disturbances promptly and the challenges in settlement control, a plain concrete backfill solution is used, improving the performance of the foundation's bearing layer through segmented pouring and strict compaction. Lastly, given the strict requirements of the bridge crane for track surface settlement differences and the complex conditions of nearby deep foundation pits, a bored pile scheme is chosen. By embedding end-bearing piles into stable rock layers, the impact of soil settlement is entirely avoided, thereby achieving a safe, economically reasonable design for the trestle pillar foundation.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the disturbance to the pit soil layers caused by large-scale excavation, which may lead to uneven foundation settlement, the technology0 natural foundation scheme is used. title: Analysis of the causes of slippage in the structural layer of a sloped roof in a dormitory building and design of a reinforcement plan
requirement: Analysis of the causes of slippage in the structural layer of a sloped roof in a dormitory building and design of a reinforcement plan Under the conditions of a slope of approximately 1:2.145 (roof angle about 25°), no rebar connection at the roof ridge, no concrete upturn at the eaves gutter, and existing water leakage issues, complete the cause analysis and reinforcement design task for the slippage of the dormitory building's sloped roof structure layer to ensure the stability of the roof structure layer.
solution: This paper proposes a reinforcement plan to address the slippage problem of the sloped roof in dormitory buildings. Specifically, first, considering that the slope of 1:2.145 may lead to slippage of the roof structural layer, the slippage area was reconstructed using roof structural layer removal technology (technology0), and the stability of the non-slipped areas was enhanced using anti-slip concrete pier reinforcement technology (technology1). Second, to address the issues of no steel tie connections at the roof ridge and non-compliance in eave gutter construction, the structural layer connection technology (technology2) was adopted to improve overall integrity by connecting with galvanized flat steel. Finally, to solve problems of water infiltration and drainage, modified asphalt waterproof coatings were applied, and waterproof membranes (technology3) were installed, effectively achieving roof waterproofing and anti-slip protection. The reinforced roof has been in use for nearly two years, achieving excellent performance.
