Meanwhile, use technology1 to reinforce the non-sliding areas with concrete piers.

For analysis1, considering the issues of the ridge lacking tie steel bars and the eaves gutter not being constructed according to the design, to compensate for the design deficiencies, technology2 is adopted to reinforce with galvanized flat steel arranged longitudinally and integrally connect with the original structural layer through anchoring bars.

For analysis2, considering the seepage issue and the risk of slippage caused by the lack of drainage outlets, technology3 is used to apply a modified asphalt waterproof layer, while laying shale-surfaced modified asphalt waterproof membranes to minimize the risk of water accumulation.

title: Design and construction research on the excavation and support scheme of a residential area's foundation pit
requirement: Design and construction research on the excavation and support scheme of a residential area's foundation pit Under the conditions of complex geology and rainfall impact, complete the excavation and support of the foundation pit for a residential area, construct 16 unit buildings and an underground parking lot. The support design must consider the stability of the foundation pit slope, anti-sliding moment, and bottom uplift stability, and ensure compliance with all standards after construction.
solution: This paper proposes a design scheme for foundation pit support based on a composite soil nailing wall support system. Specifically, first, considering that complex geological conditions may cause slope instability and soil sliding, a composite soil nailing wall support system is adopted, which enhances slope bearing capacity and sliding resistance through micro steel pipe piles and grouted anchor pipes. Second, to address issues of outward bulging or cracking that may result from insufficient support strength, techniques such as mesh spraying of concrete and grouted anchor pipes are used to enhance support rigidity and anti-sliding capability. Additionally, to tackle the influence of rainfall and drainage issues, reasonable drainage design on-site is combined with localized support measures formed by micro steel pipe piles to ensure safe construction and stability requirements for the foundation pit. Test results indicate that after the support system is implemented, the safety factor of the grouted anchor pipes under different tension conditions exceeds 1.5, with the maximum local anti-sliding moment reaching 1.55 kN·m and the maximum overall anti-sliding moment reaching 1.49 kN·m. The safety factor for anti-uplift stability is all above 1.6, verifying the effectiveness of the support scheme.

For analysis1, considering that insufficient support strength may cause bulging or cracking, use technology1 and technology3 to enhance the rigidity and bearing capacity of the soil nail wall through grouting anchor pipe technology and mesh spraying concrete technology, thus preventing structural damage.

For analysis2, to address the potential stability issues of the foundation pit caused by rainfall, technology2 is applied. This involves strengthening the overall anti-sliding capability of the foundation pit structure by combining miniature steel pipe piles with cement grouting, while drainage measures are implemented to prevent water interference during construction.

title: Study on the Design of a Vibration Reduction Scheme for a Building's Steel Structure
requirement: Study on the Design of a Vibration Reduction Scheme for a Building's Steel Structure In the super high-rise building (298.7 meters in height, 70 floors above ground, and 6 floors underground), steel coupling beams and buckling-restrained braces (BRB) are applied to optimize the arrangement of energy dissipation and damping components and complete the seismic performance design under rare earthquake conditions. The goal is to effectively reduce the inter-story drift ratio and top displacement while improving overall seismic performance and the energy consumption ratio of damping components, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.
solution: This paper proposes a seismic reduction design scheme suitable for steel structures of super high-rise buildings. Specifically, firstly, considering the large volume of super high-rise buildings and the high seismic energy, which may lead to excessive inter-story drift angles and top displacements, the buckling-restrained brace (BRB) arrangement technology was adopted. Through Scheme C1, the maximum inter-story drift angle was reduced by 12.4%. Secondly, in response to the requirements for seismic performance and cost issues under rare earthquake conditions, steel coupling beam energy consumption optimization technology and the step-by-step addition of BRBs were utilized. Finally, through comparative analysis of multiple schemes, Scheme C1 was determined to be the optimal solution, i.e., arranging buckling-restrained braces (BRBs) in Area A~B. This scheme effectively improves the overall seismic performance of the building and reduces costs by reasonably reducing top displacements and inter-story drift angles while optimizing the energy consumption performance of the structure.

title: Ultrapure Water System Design for an Electronic Cleanroom
requirement: Ultrapure Water System Design for an Electronic Cleanroom Under the condition of ensuring the ultrapure water quality standard of 18.2 MΩ·cm, complete the design and implementation of the ultrapure water system for a certain electronic cleanroom to meet the demand for 34 m³/h of ultrapure water supply and 10 m³/h of first-stage RO water supply. The system design must include the water treatment process, a concentrate water recovery solution, and a stable and reliable piping system, while taking into account special requirements such as low water temperature during northern winters and a single water source.
solution: This paper proposes a design scheme for an ultrapure water system to meet the needs of a certain electronic cleanroom. Specifically, firstly, to address the extremely high water quality requirements of process equipment, the system applies the ultrafiltration + second-stage RO + EDI + polishing mixed bed process technology, using graded treatment to remove particles, organic matter, and ions, ultimately achieving a water quality of 18.2MΩ·cm. title: Design and Practice of the Jacking and Correction Scheme for a Raft Foundation Residential Building
requirement: Design and Practice of the Jacking and Correction Scheme for a Raft Foundation Residential Building Under the actual conditions of uneven settlement of the foundation and insufficient reactive force of the raft foundation, complete the jacking correction project to rectify a 6-story brick-concrete residential building with a total construction area of 1550 m² from a tilt of 16‰ to 1‰, while avoiding secondary damage to the building and ensuring that the foundation does not settle further.
solution: This paper proposes a jacking and correction scheme for severe building tilts caused by uneven foundation settlement. Specifically, first, considering the challenges of re-settlement due to uneven foundation settlement and local water erosion of collapsible silty soil, a new pile foundation underpinning technique was used. By replacing the original foundation soil with 28 end-bearing piles as a reaction platform, the load-bearing mode of the original foundation and subgrade was altered, transitioning from a raft foundation to a more stable pile-raft foundation. Secondly, addressing the difficulty of foundation heave and the complex stress preventing it from serving as a reaction platform, the synchronous control technology of PLC jacking was employed. Through precise division of jacking areas and parameter control, the building tilt was effectively corrected. Additionally, the jacking force and speed were reasonably designed to minimize the potential impact of crack friction on structural integrity. Finally, through post-recovery measures such as connection of the original raft and newly added pile foundation, as well as grouting at pile tops, the overall structural performance of the corrected building was ensured. The goal of achieving a correction precision of 1‰ was completed while avoiding secondary damage to the building.

title: Roof TLD scheme design and performance analysis of a super high-rise building
requirement: Roof TLD scheme design and performance analysis of a super high-rise building Under the condition that the height and wind-induced vibration comfort of super high-rise Building A do not meet the standard requirements, study and design a tuned liquid damper (TLD) to control wind-induced vibration, ensuring the tuning capability of the liquid sloshing frequency, the energy dissipation capacity of the paddle column, and the performance safety of the system structure under extreme conditions, thereby improving the building's wind-induced vibration comfort and meeting the requirements of JGJ 3-2010.
solution: This paper proposes a TLD design scheme to address the wind-induced vibration comfort issues of the top floors of super high-rise buildings. Specifically, first, considering the extreme height of the building and the inadequacy of wind-induced comfort standards, the TLD liquid sloshing frequency tuning technology is applied. By adjusting the liquid depth to align the sloshing frequency with the structure's natural frequency and incorporating paddle-column energy dissipation design and optimization techniques, the damping ratio is improved by 1.5%-3.5%, enhancing wind vibration control capabilities. Second, using shake table test analysis techniques, multi-point measurement, separation, and parameter identification of the tank liquid surface response signals are conducted to ensure the reliability of the design frequency and damping data. Finally, based on seismic ultimate state simulation and calculation techniques, response data under seismic conditions, including a wall pressure of 141.5 kPa and a paddle-column shear force of 18.7 kN, are calculated. This verifies the seismic performance of the TLD under extreme conditions, ensuring safety and meeting structural stability and comfort requirements.

title: Design and application of jacking and tilting correction schemes for pile foundation buildings.
requirement: Design and application of jacking and tilting correction schemes for pile foundation buildings. Under the conditions of significant building inclination, uneven soft soil foundation, and insufficient pile foundation stiffness, complete the jacking and tilt correction construction tasks for the existing building. After the correction, the building's inclination rate is required to be controlled within the allowable range of standards, while ensuring overall building stability, construction safety, and effective connection between the foundation and the superstructure.
solution: This paper proposes a construction plan for leveling and reinforcing pile foundations through jacking. Specifically, considering the risk of structural instability during construction due to building tilting caused by insufficient pile stiffness and uneven settlement, anchor static pressure pile reinforcement technology is adopted to provide reliable reinforcement conditions for the foundation. Secondly, meticulous design is carried out for underpinning nodes, forming a closed reaction force platform by using underpinning beams and a jack support system, with one jack reasonably placed every 1.5 meters at the nodes to ensure uniform force transmission. Then, a hydraulic jack synchronous lifting system is used to accurately control each lift by 10 mm, ensuring the differential adjustment target is achieved. Additionally, a full-process monitoring system is introduced throughout the lifting construction to dynamically monitor the lifting amounts on different axes of the building, foundation settlement, and component stress changes, while combining manual verification to optimize construction process control. Finally, after completing the leveling, the connection between the foundation and the superstructure is completed using C30 concrete pouring to ensure structural stability. The tilt ratio is ultimately controlled within the standard allowable range, achieving considerable social and economic benefits.

For analysis1, considering that complex geological conditions may affect the stability of the jacking platform, a support system of transfer beams and jacks is established using technology1, with a reasonable layout and segmented setup of jacking nodes to form a stable reaction platform. In order to further ensure the stability of the building during the lifting process, the technology3 full-process monitoring system is adopted to dynamically monitor the lifting amount, pressure, and internal structural forces throughout the entire lifting and tilting correction process, and to adjust the plan in real time to improve construction safety and accuracy.

title: Research on Management of Engineering Cost Control Measures in the Design Phase of Soil and Water Conservation Scheme

title: Design of the Automation Transformation Plan for Wenshang County Northern Water Plant
requirement: Design of the Automation Transformation Plan for Wenshang County Northern Water Plant Under the conditions of low automation levels in the control system, aging and damaged equipment, and the pressurization station being far from the water plant, completing the automation system renovation of the Chengbei Water Plant requires improving the automation levels of the water source wells, secondary pump rooms, and pressurization stations, achieving remote monitoring, and ensuring the efficient and stable operation of the water supply system.
solution: This article proposes an automation renovation plan for the Chengbei Water Plant based on PLC and wireless transmission technology. title: Low-carbon design and practice of winter heating solutions for low-rise buildings in oilfields
requirement: Low-carbon design and practice of winter heating solutions for low-rise buildings in oilfields Under the conditions of cold winter climates and high heating demands in remote oil field buildings, complete the low-temperature heat storage and low-carbon heating tasks for low-rise buildings, ensuring indoor comfort while achieving energy-saving and emission reduction goals.
solution: This paper proposes a low-temperature heat storage low-carbon design and practice for winter heating of low-rise buildings in oilfields. Specifically, first, considering the issues of unstable energy supply and high costs for oilfield heating, low-temperature heat storage technology and solar thermal technology are used. Second, to address the issues of cold winter climates and high heating demand, heat exchange and control technologies are applied. Stored heat is transferred to the heating system through heat exchangers, and the control system precisely adjusts energy release based on indoor and outdoor temperatures to ensure heating efficiency and comfort inside buildings. Finally, given the high carbon emissions of conventional fossil fuel heating methods, the green advantages of the low-temperature heat storage system are fully utilized, significantly reducing carbon emissions to 4.824×10^-6 t/m², promoting the development of low-carbon heating.

For analysis1, considering the cold winter climate conditions and the need for efficient heating, technology2 is used to efficiently transfer the energy from the heat storage tank to the building through a heat exchanger and an automatic control system, precisely adjusting the heat output to ensure heating efficiency and indoor comfort.

title: Brief Discussion on the Design of Municipal Sewage Lift Pump Station Complex Construction Plan—Taking the Xiamen Liu Wudian Sewage Lift Pump Station Construction Project as an Example
requirement: Brief Discussion on the Design of Municipal Sewage Lift Pump Station Complex Construction Plan—Taking the Xiamen Liu Wudian Sewage Lift Pump Station Construction Project as an Example Under the conditions of integrating the construction of sewage pump stations and sanitation facility complexes, complete the construction task of the Xiamen Liuwudian sewage lifting pump station, ensuring landscape integration, cost-effectiveness, and safety, while meeting the requirements for independent operation and management.
solution: This paper proposes the construction plan for the Xiamen Liu Wudian Sewage Pumping Station Complex. Specifically, first, considering the requirements for separating pedestrians and vehicles and the conditions for independent operation management, which may face the challenge of mutual interference between personnel and production processes, a pedestrian-vehicle separation scheme was adopted. Clear zoning of "sewage pumping station area on the east side and sanitation facilities area on the west side" achieved safe separation and independent operation. solution: This paper proposes a top-level reconstruction scheme based on the beam-lifting and column-removal method. Finally, to solve the problem of decreased seismic performance after reconstruction, technologies such as fish-belly-type beam-lifting and pendulum isolation bearings are adopted. By optimizing the stiffness distribution of primary and secondary beams and the design of isolation bearings, the seismic safety and stiffness stability of the overall structure are improved.

title: Design of the formwork support scheme and construction technology for cantilever sections of variable cross-section floors in high-rise buildings.

solution: This paper proposes a template support and construction process plan for cantilevered sections with variable cross-sections in high-rise buildings. Finally, through the combined application of multiple processes and plans, multiple technical challenges such as cross-section transitions, cantilever loads, and deflection control during pouring were effectively resolved, providing a reference for similar projects.

title: Analysis of the Design and Construction Key Points of Waterproofing Solutions for High-Rise Building Basements
requirement: Analysis of the Design and Construction Key Points of Waterproofing Solutions for High-Rise Building Basements Under conditions such as potential cracking of the basement concrete structure, leakage in post-cast joints, leakage from through-wall bolts and pipelines, waterproof layer failure caused by excavation disturbances, and the threat of groundwater buoyancy, complete the design and construction tasks of the waterproofing plan for the high-rise building basement to ensure long-term leakage-free performance of the basement.
solution: This paper proposes a design and construction plan for waterproofing high-rise building basements. Specifically, first, considering the issue of potential cracks in concrete, waterproof concrete pouring technology is adopted, and crack resistance is improved by optimizing the water-cement ratio and curing measures. Second, to address the risk of leakage in post-casting belts, designs employing water-stopping steel plates and closure nets are utilized to ensure seamless concrete construction. For the sealing issues related to through-wall bolts and pipes, welding water-stopping ring plates and filling with mortar are applied for sealing treatment. Additionally, to tackle the risks of cushion detachment and waterproof layer tearing caused by foundation pit disturbance, flexible waterproofing membranes and dense backfilling techniques are employed to enhance waterproofing performance. Lastly, to mitigate the threat of groundwater buoyancy, a combination of well-point active dewatering and anchor rod anti-buoyancy techniques is used to ensure the structural safety of the basement. The design and construction plan outlined in this paper has been proven in practical application to enhance the long-term waterproofing capability of basements, effectively solving various potential leakage problems.

title: Research on the Design of Plane Layout Scheme for Climbing Formwork in High-Rise Building Construction

solution: This article proposes a technical solution for the planar layout of climbing scaffolds in high-rise building construction. Specifically, first, considering that the climbing scaffold needs to meet sectional stability and connection strength between the scaffold structure and the building, sectional scaffold technology is adopted through sectional upright arrangements and auxiliary connections with short pipes, as well as scaffold-to-building connection technology using measures such as staggered pulling connections and pre-embedded steel ropes. Finally, for corner handling and other detailed issues, corner handling technology is applied by setting up cross steel pipes to create a "井"-shaped reinforcement, further enhancing the rigidity and safety performance of the climbing scaffold. The above technical measures comprehensively ensure the rationality, safety, and cost-effectiveness of the planar layout of climbing scaffolds for high-rise buildings.
